title-part.text: BODY DETAILS OR KINDS OF RAILWAY VEHICLES

reference.text: vehicles in general B60; adaptation of vehicles to special systems B61B; underframes B61F

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Kinds of railway or tramway vehicles
Carriages for ordinary railway passenger traffic
General arrangements in sleeping or couchette carriages

reference.text: B61D1/06 takes precedence; seats per se B61D33/00
tank wagons B61D5/00; hopper wagons B61D7/00; tipping wagons B61D9/00; mine cars B61D11/00; vehicles specially adapted for animal transportation B60P3/04;

title-part.text: with movable floors, e.g. rotatable or floors which can be raised or lowered
Flat wagons including posts or standards

reference.text: open loading compartments for load-carrying vehicles, in general B62D33/02; movable or detachable racks or stanchions B62D33/0207

title-part.text: comprising running gear interconnected by loads
comprising running gear interconnected by load supports facilitating low-level load transport

reference.text: vehicles adapted to carry other vehicles, in general, B60P3/06

CPC-specific-text.text: with special accommodation for the motor vehicle driver or passengers
specially adapted for heavy vehicles, e.g. public work vehicles, trucks, trailers
the heavy vehicles being of the trailer or semi-trailer type
Details, e.g. bridges for floor connections
Wheel guides for the vehicles being carried

title-part.text: Tank wagons for carrying fluent materials

CPC-specific-text.text: with loading and unloading means using fluids or vacuum
Trackside means for assisting charge or discharge
with means for cooling, heating, or insulating
Covers or access openings; Arrangements thereof

reference.text: flat bottomed cars convertible into hoppers B61D3/06

title-part.text: with discharge openings in the bottoms

reference.text: with body in two halves and discharge by tipping the halves B61D9/00

title-part.text: the openings being above axle level during discharge
with openings capable of discharging both between and outside the wheels
with openings capable of discharging only outside the wheels
the discharge being assisted by tipping the bottom
Adaptations of hopper elements to railways
controlled by means external to cars
Means for assisting charge or discharge
characterised by operating means for tipping
Adaptations of rail vehicle elements to tipping wagons
Supporting or guiding means for the bodies
Body fitments or devices facilitating or controlling outflow on discharge
Tipping systems controlled by trackside means
Other railway vehicles, e.g. scaffold cars
Adaptations of vehicles for use on railways

reference.text: conveyor frames mounted for movement on rail tracks B65G41/02; wheeled machines used in permanent way construction or maintenance E01B

title-part.text: convertible into other non-vehicular apparatus, e.g. exhibition stands
Arrangements or construction of railway vehicles for protecting them in case of collisions
Body details of railway or tramway vehicles

reference.text: for tank wagons B61D5/00; for hopper cars B61D7/00; body details specially adapted for tipping wagons B61D9/06; for mine cars B61D11/00

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: B61D17/005 takes precedence over B61D17/048 - B61D17/16

CPC-specific-text.text: with bodies characterised by use of plastics materials

reference.text: B61D17/005 takes precedence; bogie frames comprising parts made from fibre einforced matrix material B61F5/523

title-part.text: reducing air resistance by modifying contour

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Constructional features for fast vehicles sustaining sudden variations of atmospheric pressure, e.g. when crossing in tunnels

title-part.text: with composite, e.g. metal and wood body structures

CPC-specific-text.text: with bodies characterised by use of light metal, e.g. aluminium

reference.text: modular super-structures for vehicles carrying a large number of passengers B62D31/025

CPC-specific-text.text: readily releasable, i.e. dismountable or collapsible sub-units, e.g. for shipping
Interior walls, e.g. separation walls between compartments

reference.text: movable or foldable roofs, covers or tarpaulins B61D39/00
arrangement of engine rooms B61C17/04; sound insulating elements for road vehicles B60R13/08

title-part.text: Door arrangements specially adapted for rail vehicles

reference.text: locks for vehicles E05B77/00 - E05B85/00; door-operating mechanisms E05F
closure elements for hopper car discharge openings B61D7/16; doors convertible into loading and unloading ramps B61D47/00; B61D19/003 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the movements of the door
The doors being wall panels enabling complete opening of the wagon sides, e.g. for quick loading or unloading
both sliding and plugging, (e.g. for refrigerator cars)
Safety devices for preventing passengers from being injured by movements of doors or variations in air pressure

reference.text: safety devices in passenger lifts for preventing trapping of passengers between closing doors B66B13/26; acting on power-operated mechanisms for wings E05F15/00

title-part.text: Construction of steps for railway vehicles
Window arrangements peculiar to rail vehicles

reference.text: vehicle window arrangements in general B60J; cleaning vehicle windows B60S; heating arrangements specially adapted for transparent or reflecting areas H05B3/84

title-part.text: Heating, cooling, ventilating, lighting, or air-conditioning, peculiar to rail vehicles

reference.text: heating, cooling or ventilating devices for vehicles in general B60H1/00; devices for moistening air in vehicles B60H3/02; devices for filtering air in vehicles B60H3/06

CPC-specific-text.text: Means for controlling or equalizing air pressure shocks in trains, e.g. when passing or crossing in tunnels
Air-conditioning means, i.e. combining at least two of the following ways of treating or supplying air, namely heating, cooling or ventilating

reference.text: for vehicles in general B60H1/2215; supplying electric power to electric heating circuits of electrically-propelled vehicles B60L1/02

CPC-specific-text.text: combined with heating means using recuperated energy from other sources, e.g. from the brakes
the heat being derived from independent means, i.e. autonomous devices, e.g. stoves
of wagons for transporting refrigerated goods

reference.text: vehicles for transporting refrigerated goods B60P3/20

title-part.text: Furniture or furnishings peculiar to rail vehicles

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by their mounting in vehicles
Safety seats, e.g. comprising safety locking means; Seats for children
comprising toilet waste receiving, treatment, storage, disposal or removal devices
luggage rack and umbrella-stand for rail vehicles

reference.text: luggage racks within vehicle bodies in general, e.g. busses B60R5/003

CPC-specific-text.text: for restaurant cars or the like

title-part.text: Other details peculiar to rail vehicles

reference.text: systems for tipping wagons controlled by trackside means B61D9/14

title-part.text: Devices or arrangements in connection with tickets, e.g. ticket holders
Holders for cargo tickets or the like
Holders or devices for cargo tickets or the like
Devices for using the energy of the movements of the vehicles
Means or devices for securing or supporting the cargo, including protection against shocks

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for fixing to walls or floors
Fixing sheet metal, boxes, or the like
Fixing of logs, beams, barrels, pipes, or the like

title-part.text: Loading or unloading devices combined with vehicles, e.g. loading platforms,

CPC-specific-text.text: doors convertible into loading and unloading ramps

reference.text: combined with vehicles in general B60P

CPC-specific-text.text: Loading or unloading devices combined with road vehicles carrying wagons, e.g. ramps, turntables, lifting means

reference.text: wagons for carrying road vehicles in general: B61D3/18
